pronunciation: PREMED'ITATE, [Latin proemeditor; proe, before, and meditor, to mediate.]

definitions.text:
Premeditate
 To think on revolve the mind beforehand; contrive design previously; as, premeditate theft robbery.With words premeditated thus he said.PREMED'ITATE,
To think, consider revolve the mind beforehand; deliberate; have formed the mind by previous thought meditation.PREMED'ITATE,
